channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree continuing to grow after being cut down., 14th August
item.description:
This tree belongs to Gloucestershire Highways and was causing damage to my drive as well as obstructions to pedestrians and visibility issues. The tree was recently felled after I reported it on Fix My Street (web ref: 5939388 , enq num: 22048678). I was advised by the contractors that did the work that another company would return within a few days to drill into the tree stump and add roundup so that the tree would be killed. This has not happened and as you can see from the photo the tree is flowering significantly. It is disappointing that the works have not been completed. Please can the remaining work be done as soon as possible

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge branches fell off tree into driveway of 17 Keynsham Road. Damaged fence between no. 17 and no. 15. Luckily no vehicles on drive and no one passing. I have reported this tree twice already since Xmas when a falling branch from the same tree wrote my car off, the week after a larger branch fell and almost hit a traffic warden. Someone is going to get killed if this tree is not properly maintained. We can see a number of dead branches, one of which is now on the ground. Please will someone take this seriously?, 14th August
item.description:
15/17 Keynsham Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Keynsham Road, Tivoli, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging tree branches close to house, 14th August
item.description:
I live at 52 Robert Burns Avenue and we have a tree outside the front of the house which is getting very close to the building, (approximately 6 foot away). It is now causing a considerable reduction of natural light being allowed onto the house and old branches are continually dropping or being blown off by strong winds. There are many trees in our road and none of which come anywhere near as close to the houses as the one outside mine.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Robert Burns Avenue, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose and broken manhole cover rattles as vehicles pass over it., 14th August
item.description:
See photographs. On the northbound carriageway of the A435 Bishops Cleeve bypass, by the bus-stop between Hayfield Way and Sapphire Way. The problem has existed since the carriageway was resurfaced in the spring. It was reported by others via FixMyStreet in July. Today at 1406 FixMyStreet reported that the issue”has been addressed” and the ticket “closed”. After apparent GCC action this morning (14/8) the number of cars triggering the noise has indeed reduced somewhat. However cars using the outer part of the lane are still causing the broken outer part of the manhole cover to rock or even rise into the air so the intolerable noise persists, causing distress to occupants of Blackberry Grove, who live just 50-100 metres away. The problem had definitely not been resolved and and so I am raising this new report.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in road by pedestrian crossing, 14th August
item.description:
I was crossing the road from the island in the middle with my 2 year old daughter in the pram. As we've crossed, my front pram wheels got stuck in the pothole and tipped my pram over. My daughter smashed her face into the road and I also fell over. We had to call an ambulance and receive treatment at GRH.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 172, Swindon Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 street lights are not working at all, 14th August
item.description:
First 2 street light in hawthorn road coming from orchard avenue are still not working. This was first reported in may is it going to take getting the local MP involved to rectify this?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 91, Hawthorn Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
